description.narrative: By 2021, Government institutions have the capacity to provide quality WASH services to target communities.

sector.narrative: WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

"UNICEF Programmes in Eritrea (Water Sanitation and Hygiene)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Government institutions have the capacity to provide quality WASH services to target communities.

description.narrative: UNICEF Eritrea support to the Ministry of Land, Water and Environment (MoLWE) helped 31,362 people (17,194 females, target: 20,000) gain access to safe drinking water. UNICEF also supported MoLWE through training and development of a rural water supply database to enhance monitoring, reporting and capacity for data management and to ensure the functionality of WASH committees (with a minimum 30 per cent women's representation) at all four new community water supply schemes. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of people accessing safe water for drinking, cooking and personal hygiene
Number of people accessing a sustainable drinking water service in the reporting year only
Existence and implementation of national water, sanitation and hygiene sector policy and strategy
Independent minimum package of sustainability checks with a clear feedback mechanism is implemented
